item.title: Optimistic Locking vs Pessimistic Locking in .NET
item.description: Since the invention of database systems, they have become the primary source of truth for almost every web application’s data. As user demands grow, applications scale, and so does the concurrency within the system. Ensuring data integrity and consistency along with effective locking mechanisms, becomes a major concern when multiple users attempt to access and […] The post Optimistic Locking vs Pessimistic Locking in .NET appeared first on Code Maze.
